posts._title: Umberto Lenzi – Gatti rossi in un labirinto di vetro AKA Eyeball (1975)
posts.title: Gatti rossi in un labirinto di vetro
posts.excerpt: SYNOPSISA group of tourists are terrorized by a killer who wears a red raincoat and stabs its victims in the eye. Mark Burton (John Richardson) is having an affair with his secretary Paulette Stone (Martine Brochard) while his wife is suffering form a nervous breakdown. Why does the killer stab its victims in the eye …

posts._title: Ilya Khrzhanovskiy & Jekaterina Oertel – DAU. Three Days (2020)
posts.title: DAU Three Days
posts.excerpt: It is 1956. Dau is a distinguished Soviet scientist who meets up with the love of his youth – Maria, a Greek actress – during her three day visit to Moscow. They haven’t seen each other for 25 years. Dau is a successful and prosperous scientist, but feels excruciatingly dissatisfied with his family life. Through …

posts._title: Paolo Cavara – La tarantola dal ventre nero AKA Black Belly of the Tarantula (1971)
posts.title: La tarantola dal ventre nero
posts.excerpt: Inspector Tellini investigates serial crimes where victims are paralyzed while having their bellies ripped open with a sharp knife, much in the same way tarantulas are killed by the black wasp. As suspects keep dying, Inspector directs his attention to a spa all the victims had a connection with.

posts._title: Ilya Khrzhanovskiy & Ilya Permyakov – DAU. New Man (2020)
posts.title: DAU New Man
posts.excerpt: Maxim and his comrades-in-arms are participating in top-secret experiments into the creation of a new man. The employees of the secret Institute are characterised by everything Maxim detests: alcoholism, depravity, weak will, loss of ideals, and lack of faith in the future. Vika, one of the waitresses in the Institute’s cafeteria, falls in love with …

posts._title: Paul Verhoeven – Turks fruit aka Turkish Delight (1973)
posts.title: Turks fruit
posts.excerpt: Named the Best Dutch Film of the Century by the Netherlands Film Festival, Verhoeven’s hugely successful, Academy Award–nominated sophomore feature opens with a giallo-style jolt, develops into a kinky, blackly comic sexploitation romp, and finally blossoms into an alternately sweet and perverse romance. In the first of his many collaborations with Verhoeven, Rutger Hauer stars …

posts._title: Satyajit Ray – Chiriyakhana AKA The Zoo (1967)
posts.title: Chiriyakhana
posts.excerpt: Chiriakhana or Chiriyakhana (Bengali: চিড়িয়াখানা; English: The Zoo) is a 1967 Indian Bengali-language crime thriller film, based on the story of the same name by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay, directed by Satyajit Ray starring Uttam Kumar as Byomkesh Bakshi. The screenplay is written by Satyajit Ray.

posts.title: Winter adé
posts.excerpt: Quote:Traveling by train from one end of the country to the other, the DEFA documentary team interviewed East German women of different ages and backgrounds. In this masterpiece, they reveal their personal and professional frustrations, hopes and aspirations–and, in doing so, paint a portrait of a changing society. This ground-breaking documentary caused a sensation when …

posts._title: Chris Marker – Si j’avais quatre dromadaires AKA If I Had Four Dromedaries (1966) (HD)
posts.title: Si j’avais quatre dromadaires
posts.excerpt: Quote:Composed entirely of still photographs shot by Marker himself over the course of his restless travel through twenty-six countries, If I Had Four Dromedaries stages a probing, at times agitated, search for the meanings of the photographic image.

posts._title: Yuri Kara – Zavtra byla voyna AKA Tomorrow Was the War [+Extras] (1987)
posts.title: Zavtra byla voyna
posts.excerpt: This film is based on a novel by Boris Vasiliev and takes place in a small Russian provincial town in 1940, one year before Germany invaded the Soviet Union. The every day life of class 9B is a larger than life portrait of Stalininism and of unconditional loyalty to party dogma. At a birthday party …

posts._title: Julien Temple – The Great Rock ‘n’ Roll Swindle [+extra] (1980)
posts.title: The Great Rock ‘n’ Roll Swindle [+extra]
posts.excerpt: The Great Rock ‘n’ Roll Swindle is a 1980 British mockumentary film directed by Julien Temple and produced by Don Boyd and Jeremy Thomas. It centres on the British punk rock band Sex Pistols and, most prominently, their manager Malcolm McLaren.
